title: Improper Access Control in Ali Express Importer

profile.name: Judge.me
profile.about: Judge.me powers the product reviews for e-commerce stores. Our apps help you collect and display reviews on Shopify, WooCommerce and BigCommerce.

vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Good day team,

I found another improper access control flaw in Ali Express Review Importer that can be used to view all and any existing reviews in Judge.Me app. This is similar to my other reports  #1450807 and #1382652. Basically the same bug with #1450807 just on a different app and endpoint :)

## Steps To Reproduce:

1. Login as an admin to your test Shopify instance

2. Install the apps 'Judge.me Product Reviews' and 'Ali Express Review Importer' (both owned by Judge.me)

2. Add a new review to your Judge.Me app. 'Reviews' ->  'Write a Review'

2. Add/Edit a Shopify staff member and give access only to 'Ali Express Review Importer' app 

2. Login to the staff account with only 'Ali Express Review Importer'

2. Go to apps and open the 'Ali Express Review Importer' to establish/start Judge.me session

2. Visit this url to attempt to view reviews from Judge.Me App: `https://judge.me/index.json?shopdomain={yourshop}.myshopify.com&page=1&2. 
per_page=25&offset=0` . Capture the request for this using any proxy intercepting tool like Burp Suite 

2. Since you don't have a valid session for the Judge.Me app you will be prompted to login as a shop owner

2. Now in the 'Ali Express Review Importer app, click 'Reviews' -> and then click the refresh icon on the left side of the search bar. Capture the request for this one too since we'd need the cookie in the request.
{F1785201}

2. Replace the cookie in the request from step 7 to the recently acquired cookie in step 9

2. Send the edited request, the request from step 6 with the new cookie, and you should now be able to view any reviews including hidden/archived ones from Judge.Me App without having access to the Judge.Me app itself

Note: 
Steps 1-4 are done by Admin
Steps 5-11 are done by user with only Ali Express Importer access

## Supporting Material/References:
{F1785202}

If you have any questions on this or if there's anything I can help with please let me know.

Have a nice day!

-PenguinsHelp

## Impact

Staff with no access to 'Judge.me App' can view reviews which they supposedly doesn't have access to

activities.message: Hi @penguinshelp - I'm discussing this submission internally with the Judge.me  team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!

Good day team,

Any updates on this?

Have a nice day!

Hi @penguinshelp , @bassguitar 

Thank you so much. I hope you are well.

It is duplicated with https://hackerone.com/bugs?report_id=1093536&subject=judgeme https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=judgeme&report_id=1522785 because the session should be expired in 12 hours.

Could you please help recheck it.

Cheers,

Hi @lucdang2804,

Sorry but I don't agree with the evaluation since as far as I can see this is not a duplicate of those reports.

#1093536 and #1522785 are both reports concerning access when users are removed/deactivated from the Shopify account or their access to the specific apps got removed. The 12 hour expiration method you mentioned work as a fix for both those reports

This one however is an issue that happens due to improper permission validation across two applications with different set access required so the 12 hour access does not apply to this. This is the same with #1450807 which was already fixed by the team however the bug in this report was missed. The attacker have access to Ali Review Importer and not Judge.Me however the attacker can access data from Judge.Me.

Please review the report again and consider if possible :)

If you have any further questions or if theres anything I can help with please let me know.

Cheers!

Hi @penguinshelp 

I see what's you mean. As our business logic, we allow AERI user can access some judge.me apis as https://judge.me/index.json?... 

The report will be valid if you can help us find some sensitive places as delete, curate, update reviews, list reviews of other shops...

Thanks.

Hi @lucdang2804,

Thanks for the update on this, unfortunately the only thing AERI users can do with this is to 'view' reviews from Judge.Me regardless of their status published, hidden and even PII censored reviews which as it says contain PII. 

I still think this is an issue since different use-cases of users may want the admin to limit users only to AERI reviews and not reviews in the main Judge.Me app.

I haven't tried the write (edit,delete) function for those yet and can't at the moment due to time constraints but I will try as soon as possible.

If you have any questions please let me know.

Cheers!

Hi @lucdang2804,

Can I also ask you to take a look at  #1595905. That should have been a valid report but I just noticed today that there was a misunderstanding to the report haha.

Cheers,
PenguinsHelp

Hi @penguinshelp ,

About the #1595905 report, I will follow up and revalidate it.

Good day team,

Since it has been a while, would it be possible to ask for any updates on this?

Have a nice day!

-PenguinsHelp

Hi @penguinshelp  @bassguitar .
Thank you for your submission. I hope you are well. 

As I explained, there doesn’t seem to be any security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing. 
If you are able to leverage this to write/update/delete reviews of other shops, we will happy to reevaluate this report, but at this time, it does not present a significant security risk.

So I will close this report as informative.

Kind regards,
Luc

Hi @lucdang2804,

Thanks for the update on this. This one is basically the same to #1450807 (which was evaluated and fixed) so I don't understand why the evaluation changed here haha.

That said I will respect your evaluation and I will reach out again if I find anything else.

Best regards,
PenguinsHelp
As a result, we will be closing this report as informative. We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future.

Hi again team,

An update to this, I just found out I can edit reviews on Judge.Me app with this too using only Ali Express Review Importer access.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Import a sample Ali Express review

2. Edit the imported review and capture the request. It is a POST request to this url `https://judge.me/shopify/update_review`

3. Change the ID in the request to the ID of Judge.Me review. You can get the IDs with the url from the original report. `https://judge.me/index.json`

4. Submit the request and the Judge.Me review would be updated

NOTE: these steps to reproduce are for users WITHOUT access to Judge.Me App reviews and only have access to AERI

{F1840719}

If you have any questions on this please let me know.

Cheers!

Hi again team,

Just bumping this report. I really think this is a vulnerability that should be fixed especially now with the update that I sent where AERI users can edit the reviews directly in Judge.Me app without having direct access to it.

Have a nice day.

-PenguinsHelp

Just bumping the update request for thins one :)

Have a nice day!

Bumping the update request for this one :)

Have a nice day!

-PenguinsHelp

Good day team,

Just bumping the request update here again :)

Regardless of the decision though, I'd like request a disclosure on this one if possible since it's one of the interesting and fairly safe among my reports to the team. I'd wait for your response first though before requesting.

Have a nice day!

-PenguinsHelp

Hi @lucdang2804 and @h1_analyst_layla,

Bumping the disclosure request for this, #1397940 and #1522785 :)

Have a nice day.

Hi @penguinshelp,

Sorry for the very late reply! Our timeline has been very tight in the last few months so we didn't have a chance to really check your report again. 

We are able to reproduce your report and will work on a fix for it.

Hi @linhdam ,

Thanks for the update and reward! Didn't have expect this one to still be accepted to be honest haha, thank you for the consideration! 

Regarding the attack complexity though, I don't believe that it's 'High' since all the requirements are pretty basic. All it needs is the access to AERI, then edit captured requests to alter Judge.Me reviews.

That said though thank you again for reconsidering the report =)

Have a great day!

Best,
PenguinsHelp

Hi @penguinshelp 

We have fixed the issue, can you please help retest this?

About the Attack complexity, we'd say the attacker has to know the review ID as a precondition for this exploit to work.
You are right that `Attack Complexity` should be `Low`.

Hi @penguinshelp 

Thanks for the retest and for the explanation! Attackers can take the IDs from the `/index` endpoint so `Attack Complexity` should be `Low` indeed. We have increased the bounty to match with the new `Medium` severity of the report.

Hi @linhdam,

Thank you very much for the confirmation and additional reward!

As mentioned before I'd like to disclose this to the community :)

You may take your time on this one though just in case you intend to fix the index.json one. I'd totally understand and will be waiting for approval along with my other disclosure requests.

Have a great day!

-PenguinsHlep
